subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
First attested in the word {{zh-l|*怎生}} {{defdate|10th c.}} ({{zh-ref|Yuan et al., 1996}}).

Contraction of {{ltc-l|作|id=3}} + some variant of {{ltc-l|物|thing; what}}, literally “to do what” ({{zh-ref|Norman, 1988}}). This is evidenced in forms found in the {{w|Tang dynasty|Tang}} and {{w|Song dynasty|Song}} dynasties ({{zh-ref|Yuan et al., 1996}}): {{ltc-l|作勿生|id=3,y,1}} {{defdate|8th c.}}, {{ltc-l|作沒生|id=3,y,1}} {{defdate|8th c.}}, {{ltc-l|作摩|id=3,1}} {{defdate|10th c.}}, {{ltc-l|作麼|id=3,y}} {{defdate|10th c.}}.
